title: Placeholders
description: AnimationLib isn't just for putting some PlaceholderAPI placeholders in your text
There's tons of magical stuff you can use in it
NOTE: Need to use the % symbol? Use \\% or %%!

values.name: Formulas
description: Need to make any sort of calculation? I've got you covered!
Surround your formula with \\() to make it work
Formulas account for operator precedence and allow groups
Valid operators:
+, -, *, /, mod, ^, log, max, min
'mod' returns the remainder after division, so 11 mod 3 results in 2 (11 is 3 times 3 with a remainder of 2)
'max' and 'min' return the max and min value of the values on the left and right, respectively. 1 max 4 would give 4
You can also use special functions, using <functionname>(<calculation>), like sqrt(4):
sqrt, square, round, floor (round down), ceil (round up), ln, (a)sin, (a)cos, (a)tan, abs, random
'random(n)' returns a value between 0 inclusively and n exclusively (with decimal digits!)
Some examples:
\\(:#:%player_health% / %player_max_health% * 100)% health
\\(:#:%player_food_level% * 5)% food

values.name: Unicode characters
description: Use special unicode characters by specifying their id (in hexadecimal format)
There's 2 ways to do this:
With \u005CuXXXX where XXXX is the hexadecimal index of the character in the unicode table
With \u005CxXX. This is basically the above but for a smaller range, could be prettier
The website I use for finding characters is https://unicode-table.com/

values.name: Box
values.description: Useful shortcut for putting in a filled box. Use \\o for it.
